required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of PG-530742 in the Treatment of Mild to Moderate Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of PG-530742 in the Treatment of Mild to Moderate Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: Matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) have been implicated in the cartilage degradation. PG-530742 inhibits some MMPs, potentially limiting cartilage degradation and disease progression. This study will test the efficacy and safety of PG-530742 in the treatment of mild to moderate knee osteoarthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: Matrix metalloproteinases have been implicated in the cartilage degradation that occurs in osteoarthritis. PG-530742 inhibits some of these matrix metalloproteinases, thus potentially limiting cartilage degradation and disease progression. This study will test the efficacy and safety of PG-530742 in the treatment of mild to moderate knee osteoarthritis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Minimum Joint Space Width in the Medial Compartment of the Tibiofemoral Joint of the Signal Knee After 1 Year of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: The structural primary efficacy endpoint is the 1-year change from baseline in minimum joint space width (JSW) in the medial compartment of the tibiofemoral joint of the signal knee, as measured by microfocal knee radiographs obtained in the semi-flexed position.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) Total Score at 1 Year
primary_outcome.description: The symptomatic primary efficacy endpoint is the change in total WOMAC scores after 1 year of treatment. The WOMAC consists of 24 items divided into 3 subscales: Pain (5 items), Stiffness (2 items), Physical Function (17 items). The WOMAC uses descriptors for all items: none, mild moderate, severe, and extreme (corresponding to an ordinal scale of 0-4.) Scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. The total WOMAC score is created by summing the items for all three subscales (min=0, max=96)

intervention.description: One 25 mg PG-530742 tablet, twice daily for for one year
One placebo tablet, twice daily for for one year
One 50 mg PG-530742 tablet, twice daily for for one year
100 mg PG-530742 tablet, twice a day for one year
200 mg PG-530742 tablet, twice a day for one year

outcome.title: Change in Minimum Joint Space Width in the Medial Compartment of the Tibiofemoral Joint of the Signal Knee After 1 Year of Treatment
outcome.description: The structural primary efficacy endpoint is the 1-year change from baseline in minimum joint space width (JSW) in the medial compartment of the tibiofemoral joint of the signal knee, as measured by microfocal knee radiographs obtained in the semi-flexed position.
outcome.population: An intent-to-treat (ITT) analysis was conducted on all patients who were randomized and took at least one dose of study drug. Any missing data for these patients was not imputed in the primary analysis. analysis.

outcome.title: Change in Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) Total Score at 1 Year
outcome.description: The symptomatic primary efficacy endpoint is the change in total WOMAC scores after 1 year of treatment. The WOMAC consists of 24 items divided into 3 subscales: Pain (5 items), Stiffness (2 items), Physical Function (17 items). The WOMAC uses descriptors for all items: none, mild moderate, severe, and extreme (corresponding to an ordinal scale of 0-4.) Scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. The total WOMAC score is created by summing the items for all three subscales (min=0, max=96)
outcome.population: An intent-to-treat (ITT) analysis was conducted on all patients who were randomized and took at least one dose of study drug. Any missing data for these patients was not imputed in the primary analysis.

measure.description: The symptomatic primary efficacy endpoint is the change in total WOMAC scores after 1 year of treatment. The WOMAC consists of 24 items divided into 3 subscales: Pain (5 items), Stiffness (2 items), Physical Function (17 items). The WOMAC uses descriptors for all items: none, mild moderate, severe, and extreme (corresponding to an ordinal scale of 0-4.) Scores are summed for items in each subscale, with possible ranges as follows: pain=0-20, stiffness=0-8, physical function=0-68. The total WOMAC score is created by summing the items for all three subscales (min=0, max=96)
